document.masterDocTitle: Substrate dependent talitrid amphipods from fragmented beaches on the north coast of Crete (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Talitridae), including a redefinition of the genus Orchestia and descriptions of Orchestia xylino sp. nov. and Cryptorchestia gen. nov.

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Substrate dependent talitrid amphipods from fragmented beaches on the north coast of Crete (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Talitridae), including a redefinition of the genus Orchestia and descriptions of Orchestia xylino sp. nov. and Cryptorchestia gen. nov.

bibRefCitation.author: Cecchini
bibRefCitation.refString: Cecchini, C. (1928) Contributo alla conoscenze degli anfipodi. Memoria Reale Comitato Talassografico Italiano, 142, 1 - 10.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
1 specimen
, P. 89314 , Gouves, Heraklion, Crete, Greece (
35 ° 20 ' 6 "N
25 ° 18 ' 51 "E
), mixed east beach, transect A - trap 0, L. Fanini,
December 2011
;
3 specimens
, P. 89315 , Kokkini Hani, Heraklion, Crete, Greece (
35 ° 20 ' 2 "N
25 ° 16 ' 26 "E
), banquette beach, transect B - trap 2 , L. Fanini,
January 2012
;
3 specimens
, P. 89316 , Gournes, Heraklion, Crete, Greece (
35 ° 20 ' 1 "N
25 ° 16 ' 82 "E
), mixed west beach, transect B - trap 2 , L. Fanini,
January 2012
;
7 specimens
, P. 89317 , Kokkini Hani, Heraklion, Crete, Greece (
35 ° 20 ' 2 "N
25 ° 16 ' 26 "E
), banquette beach, transect B - trap 5 , L. Fanini,
January 2012
.

Diagnosis (based on adult male). Gnathopod 1 carpus with projecting palmate lobe. Gnathopod 2 propodus palm reaching 52 % along posterior margin; dactylus slender distally. Pereopod 7 not sexually dimorphic. Telson with 7–9 apical and lateral robust setae per lobe.

Distribution. An apparent Mediterranean Sea endemic widely reported from the coasts of France (
Mateus & Mateus, 1959
,
Bellan-Santini 1993
); Italy (
Cecchini 1928
,
Ruffo 1951 a
,
Bellan-Santini 1993
); Yugoslavia (
G. Karaman, 1973 c
); Greece (
Vecchi, 1929
,
Ruffo, 1937 a
,
Karaman, 1973 c
,
Bellan-Santini 1993
,
De Matthaeis et al . 2000
, this study); Turkey (Geldiay, et al ., 197 l); the Black Sea (Sezgin & Katağan 2007 ); and Libya (
Maccagno 1939
).
